summary: Bad weather can snarl air travel. Air traffic controllers make weather-related decisions, like changing a plane's route, for safety and efficiency. The National Weather Service puts aviation meteorologists on-site at the Federal Aviation Administration's air traffic control centers to help. They give regular briefings and can tailor a forecast for a specific route if needed. However, the number of aviation meteorologists has fallen considerably, with...
title: Aviation Meteorologists: Urgent Actions Needed to Address Staffing Concerns
